### AI

*   [pathfun](https://codeberg.org/apicici/pathfun) - Pure Lua library for 2D pathfinding using the funnel algorithm.
*   [beehive.lua (‚≠ê21)](https://github.com/drhayes/beehive.lua) - A functional behavior tree implementation.
*   [Luafinding (‚≠ê43)](https://github.com/GlorifiedPig/Luafinding) - Class-based A\* implementation written purely in Lua.

### Camera

*   [cam11](https://notabug.org/pgimeno/cam11) - Camera library that leverages the Transform object introduced in love2d 11.0+.
*   [parallax (‚≠ê19)](https://github.com/idbrii/love-parallax) - Parallax scrolling with any camera system; seamlessly tile background images.

### Development

*   [LoveDebug (‚≠ê41)](https://github.com/flamendless/lovedebug) - Inline console-like debugger utility.
*   [loveprofiler (‚≠ê11)](https://github.com/dknight/loveprofiler) - LoveProfiler is an extremely simple logger and profiler.
*   [vudu (‚≠ê48)](https://github.com/deltadaedalus/vudu) - Broad in-game debugging gui with a console, variable browser/editor, speed controls, and more.

### Drawing

### Entity

### Helpers

*   [grove.color (‚≠ê18)](https://github.com/FloatingBanana/Grove/blob/master/grove/color.lua) - Blend, convert and interpolate colors using 'color objects'.
*   [lua-state-machine (‚≠ê382)](https://github.com/kyleconroy/lua-state-machine) - Lua Finite State Machine.
*   [Manami (‚≠ê54)](https://github.com/MikuAuahDark/NPad93/blob/master/manami.lua) - An improved "reflowprint" with UTF-8, multicolor, and justify support.
*   [YAS (‚≠ê2)](https://github.com/kithf/yas) - Yet Another Screen manager.
*   [Scenery (‚≠ê33)](https://github.com/paltze/scenery) - A dead simple scene/state management system.
*   [GameStateManager (‚≠ê18)](https://github.com/GwyrddGlas/GameStateManager) - A lightweight, optimized, and easy-to-implement solution for efficient game state management.

### Input

*   [GamepadGuesser (‚≠ê15)](https://github.com/idbrii/love-gamepadguesser) - Get the right button icons for gamepads; load updated gamepad db.
*   [Kazari (‚≠ê12)](https://github.com/MikuAuahDark/Kazari) - Multitouch gesture and input library.

### Performance

*   [AppleCake (‚≠ê26)](https://github.com/EngineerSmith/AppleCake) - Profiling library for L√ñVE, with detailed profiling and thread support.

### Platforms

*   [L√ñVE Potion (‚≠ê606)](https://github.com/lovebrew/lovepotion) - Unofficial implementation of the L√ñVE for Nintendo (3DS, Switch and Wii U) Homebrew.

### Shaders

*   [ShaderScan (‚≠ê12)](https://github.com/idbrii/love-shaderscan) - Adds hot reload, includes, and better error messages for faster shader iteration.

### Tweening

*   [NAniTe (‚≠ê54)](https://github.com/MikuAuahDark/NPad93/blob/master/nanite.lua) - Timeline-based animation system that supports forward and backward update.

### UI

*   [cimgui-love](https://codeberg.org/apicici/cimgui-love) - L√ñVE module for Dear ImGui obtained by wrapping cimgui (programmatically generated C-api) using LuaJIT FFI, easy to update to the latest Dear Imgui version.
*   [Layouter (‚≠ê17)](https://github.com/nekromoff/layouter) - A simple UI **grid layout** library for L√ñVE 2D game engine.
*   [Slicy (‚≠ê14)](https://github.com/wqferr/slicy) - A newer 9patch/9slice library fixing some issues with Patchy.
*   [YUI](https://gitea.it/1414codeforge/yui) - Declarative UI library for L√ñVE.
*   [Inky (‚≠ê70)](https://github.com/Keyslam/Inky) - Any-purpose GUI framework.

### Utilities

*   [nativefs (‚≠ê48)](https://github.com/EngineerSmith/nativefs) - Read and write files outside of L√ñVE's allowed paths.

### Distribution

*   [L√ñVE Actions](https://github.com/love-actions) - Build & deploy cross-platform game packages on ***ALL*** popular platforms. Supports Android, iOS, Linux, maxOS, Windows.
*   [love-fuser (‚≠ê19)](https://github.com/MikuAuahDark/love-fuser) - Packages L√ñVE Games using GitHub Actions. Supports Windows, Linux, and Android.

items.content_text:
### 3D

*   [anim9 (‚≠ê29)](https://github.com/excessive/anim9) - 3D skeletal animation library (design to be used with IQM and IQE).

*   [Lovox (‚≠ê53)](https://github.com/tjakka5/Lovox) - Pseudo-3D library for working with voxels.

### AI

*   [Jumper (‚≠ê636)](https://github.com/Yonaba/Jumper) - Grid-based pathfinding library.
*   [Lua-star (‚≠ê75)](https://github.com/wesleywerner/lua-star) - Easy and pure Lua A\* path finding.

### Animation

*   [andross (‚≠ê33)](https://github.com/pfirsich/andross) - A Lua library for 2D skeletal/bone animations with a L√∂ve backend.
*   [anim8 (‚≠ê861)](https://github.com/kikito/anim8) - Animation library.
*   [animx (‚≠ê29)](https://github.com/YoungNeer/animx) - A featureful Animation library for loading animations from XML files!.
*   [chiro (‚≠ê28)](https://github.com/bjornbytes/chiro) - Convenience wrapper around [Spine](http://esotericsoftware.com).
*   [Peachy (‚≠ê109)](https://github.com/josh-perry/peachy) - A parser/renderer for Aseprite animations in L√ñVE.
*   [skeletor (‚≠ê23)](https://github.com/pelevesque/skeletor) - 2D skeletal animation system.
*   [Walt (‚≠ê61)](https://github.com/davisdude/Walt) - Animation library.
*   [Lump (‚≠ê20)](https://github.com/sixFingers/lump) - Adobe Flash animation runtime.
*   [lovanim (‚≠ê35)](https://github.com/patrixr/love-animation) - A minimal stateful animation library.
*   [SYSL-Text (‚≠ê103)](https://github.com/SystemLogoff/SYSL-Text) - Text animation and automatic wrapping library based on tags.

### Camera

*   [Brady (‚≠ê61)](https://github.com/davisdude/Brady) - Camera library with parallax scrolling.
*   [Editgrid (‚≠ê49)](https://github.com/bakpakin/Editgrid) - Gamera and HUMP compatible scaling grid.
*   [gamera (‚≠ê285)](https://github.com/kikito/gamera) - Camera system.
*   [hump.camera](https://hump.readthedocs.io/en/latest/camera.html) - Camera library with window locking and smooth camera movement interpolation.

### Development

*   [FPSGraph (‚≠ê19)](https://github.com/icrawler/FPSGraph) - Small FPS graphing utility.
*   [debugGraph (‚≠ê35)](https://github.com/Mechazawa/Love-Debug-Graph) - Small OO FPS graphing utillity based on FPSGraph.
*   [Lovebird (‚≠ê309)](https://github.com/rxi/lovebird) - Browser-based debug console.
*   [lurker (‚≠ê330)](https://github.com/rxi/lurker) - Auto-swaps changed Lua files in a running game.
*   [L√ñVE API (‚≠ê332)](https://github.com/love2d-community/love-api) - The complete API documentation of L√ñVE in a Lua table.
*   [L√ñVE Build (‚≠ê64)](https://github.com/nhartland/love-build) - GitHub Action for automated cross-platform builds.
*   [L√ñVE TypeScript Definitions (‚≠ê123)](https://github.com/hazzard993/love-typescript-definitions) - Write L√ñVE games with TypeScript.
*   [lovelier (‚≠ê27)](https://github.com/patrixr/lovelier) - A L√ñVE live reloader with Moonscript support.

### Drawing

*   [Artal (‚≠ê43)](https://github.com/unXedDani/Artal) - A .PSD parsing library for L√ñVE.
*   [Autobatch (‚≠ê115)](https://github.com/rxi/autobatch) - Small L√ñVE module to automate the use of SpriteBatches.
*   [center (‚≠ê17)](https://github.com/S-Walrus/center) - A simple module to dynamically align and fit content to screens of any size.
*   [deep (‚≠ê90)](https://github.com/Nikaoto/deep) - Adds Z axis; allows you to queue actions and draw calls.
*   [draft (‚≠ê53)](https://github.com/pelevesque/draft) - A module for drawing complex shapes.
*   [HSLUV (‚≠ê47)](https://github.com/hsluv/hsluv-lua) - Lua implementation of HSLuv (a human-friendly alternative to HSL).
*   [Maid64 (‚≠ê56)](https://github.com/adekto/maid64) - Low resolution scaler for L√ñVE.
*   [Push (‚≠ê572)](https://github.com/Ulydev/push) - A simple resolution-handling library for L√ñVE.
*   [renderplanet (‚≠ê20)](https://github.com/meric/renderplanet/) - Realistic orthographic planet rendering.
*   [svglover (‚≠ê54)](https://github.com/globalcitizen/svglover) - Library to import and display simple SVGs in L√ñVE.
*   [SYSL-Pixel (‚≠ê33)](https://github.com/SystemLogoff/Sysl-Pixel) - Pixel art focused scaler for graphics, position, screen-captures and shaders.
*   [S√∂lar (‚≠ê8)](https://github.com/JanWerder/soelar) - A fairly simple solar system simulator.
*   [Tove2d (‚≠ê181)](https://github.com/poke1024/tove2d) - Animated vector graphics for L√ñVE.
*   [turtle.lua (‚≠ê100)](https://github.com/arthurealike/turtle.lua) - Turtle graphics library for L√ñVE.
*   [Runtime-TextureAtlas (‚≠ê21)](https://github.com/EngineerSmith/Runtime-TextureAtlas) - Texture atlas packer and renderer at runtime; no external tools.

### Entity

*   [adorbs (‚≠ê33)](https://github.com/JosephShering/adorbs) - Minimal, Functional Entity Component System.
*   [Concord (‚≠ê281)](https://github.com/Tjakka5/Concord) - A feature-complete ECS library.

*   [nata (‚≠ê50)](https://github.com/tesselode/nata) - Hybrid OOP/ECS entity management.
*   [tiny-ecs (‚≠ê740)](https://github.com/bakpakin/tiny-ecs) - Entity Component System for Lua that's simple, flexible, and useful.

### Helpers

*   [astray (‚≠ê165)](https://github.com/SiENcE/astray) - Astray is a lua based maze, room and dungeon generation library for dungeon crawlers and roguelike video games.
*   [batteries (‚≠ê409)](https://github.com/1bardesign/batteries/) - Fills out lua's sparse standard library and provides implementations of common algorithms and data structures useful for games.
*   [clove (‚≠ê30)](https://github.com/YoungNeer/clove) - A helper library which allows you to quickly loads huge amount of assets.
*   [iffy (‚≠ê28)](https://github.com/YoungNeer/iffy) - A SpriteSheet and Tileset helper library for L√ñVE.
*   [knife (‚≠ê485)](https://github.com/airstruck/knife) - Collection of useful micro-modules for Lua (Class, State Machines, Bind, Chain, Coroutines, Event, Memoize, Entity, Tests, Timer).
*   [shard (‚≠ê20)](https://github.com/MineGame159/shard) - Collection of useful mini modules.
*   [love-state-switcher (‚≠ê11)](https://github.com/nekromoff/love-state-switcher) - State switcher class for Lua L√ñVE Engine.
*   [lue (‚≠ê46)](https://github.com/Ulydev/lue) - Lue is a L√ñVE library that allows you to display hue color effects in your game.
*   [lume (‚≠ê1.1k)](https://github.com/rxi/lume/) - Collection of functions for Lua, geared towards game development.
*   [narrator (‚≠ê149)](https://github.com/astrochili/narrator) - An Ink narrative scripting language parser and runtime implementation.
*   [reflowprint (‚≠ê50)](https://github.com/josefnpat/reflowprint) - A library designed for alignment of text that is shown one character at a time.
*   [roomy (‚≠ê60)](https://github.com/tesselode/roomy) - Screen management library for L√ñVE.
*   [rotLove (‚≠ê280)](https://github.com/paulofmandown/rotLove) - Roguelike Toolkit in L√ñVE. A L√ñVE/lua port of rot.js.
*   [ScreenManager (‚≠ê34)](https://github.com/rm-code/screenmanager) - Screen/State Management for the L√ñVE framework.
*   [shack (‚≠ê65)](https://github.com/Ulydev/shack) - Shack is a L√ñVE library that lets you easily add screen effects such as shake and rotation.
*   [Simple Tiled Implementation (‚≠ê967)](https://github.com/karai17/Simple-Tiled-Implementation) - Tiled map loader and renderer.
*   [Vivid (‚≠ê60)](https://github.com/WetDesertRock/vivid) - Color math, manipulation and conversion library.
*   [Yonder (‚≠ê17)](https://github.com/thenerdie/Yonder) - A ridiculously easy to use game state management library for LOVE2D.

### Input

*   [baton (‚≠ê241)](https://github.com/tesselode/baton) -  Input library for L√ñVE that bridges the gap between keyboard and gamepad controls.
*   [love-microphone (‚≠ê61)](https://github.com/LPGhatguy/love-microphone) - Simple microphone support for L√ñVE.

### Lighting

*   [lighter (‚≠ê41)](https://github.com/speakk/lighter) - A performant dynamic light implementation with a simple API.
*   [Sh√§dows (‚≠ê178)](https://github.com/matiasah/shadows) - A Shadows & Lights engine for L√ñVE.

### Math

*   [vector.lua (‚≠ê56)](https://github.com/themousery/vector.lua) - A simple vector library based on the PVector class from processing.

### Music

*   [denver (‚≠ê88)](https://github.com/superzazu/denver.lua) - A L√∂ve custom waveform generation library.
*   [lovebpm (‚≠ê90)](https://github.com/rxi/lovebpm) - A L√ñVE library for syncing events to the BPM of an audio track.

### Networking

### OO

*   [30log (‚≠ê477)](https://github.com/Yonaba/30log) - Minified framework for object-orientation in Lua. It features named (and unnamed) classes, single inheritance and a basic support for mixins.
*   [classic (‚≠ê961)](https://github.com/rxi/classic/) - Tiny class module for Lua. Attempts to stay simple and provide decent performance by avoiding unnecessary over-abstraction.

### Performance

### Physics

*   [Strike (‚≠ê30)](https://github.com/Aweptimum/Strike) - 2D collision detection library. Extendable, based on Separating-Axis-Theorem.

### Platforms

*   [LoveFTW](https://bitbucket.org/T-BoneISS/l-veftw) - Work-in-progress port to Windows phone 8.1.

*   [Love.js (‚≠ê736)](https://github.com/Davidobot/love.js) - L√ñVE ported to the web using Emscripten.

### Publishing

*   [Love-Snap-Template (‚≠ê24)](https://github.com/popey/love-snap-template) - A template for packaging L√ñVE games for distribution in the Snappy Store.
*   [AppImageKit (‚≠ê9.1k)](https://github.com/AppImage/AppImageKit) - Using AppImageKit you can package L√ñVE games as AppImages that run on common Linux-based operating systems, such as RHEL, CentOS, Ubuntu, Fedora, debian and derivatives; one game = one file.

### Serialization

*   [arson (‚≠ê12)](https://github.com/flamendless/arson.lua) - Companion library for registering custom data types that can be encoded and decoded by json.lua.
*   [binser (‚≠ê211)](https://github.com/bakpakin/binser) - Customizable Lua Serializer.

*   [knife.serialize (‚≠ê485)](https://github.com/airstruck/knife/blob/master/readme/serialize.md) - Serialize data as a Lua script.
*   [Lady (‚≠ê37)](https://github.com/gvx/Lady) - Saving and loading savegames; based on Ser.

*   [Ser (‚≠ê81)](https://github.com/gvx/Ser) - Fast, robust, richly-featured table serialization library for Lua.

*   [trickle (‚≠ê31)](https://github.com/bjornbytes/trickle) - A bitstream library focused on high compression for use in networking.

### Shaders

*   [LoveShaderConverter (‚≠ê90)](https://github.com/tsteinholz/LoveShaderConverter) - Convert Shadertoy Shader files to L√ñVE GLSL Files with handy utilities for infinite purposes.
*   [Shadertoy viewer](http://love2d.org/forums/viewtopic.php?f=5\&t=80885) - Run code copied from shadertoy directly or output the converted code to a L√ñVE shader.

### Testing

### Tweening

### UI

*   [GOOi (‚≠ê229)](https://github.com/tavuntu/gooi) - Android-oriented GUI library.

### Utilities

*   [particle-system-playground (‚≠ê14)](https://github.com/santoslove/particle-system-playground) - A basic L√ñVE particle system editor.
*   [require.lua (‚≠ê11)](https://github.com/premek/require.lua) - Require all files in a folder.
*   [splashy (‚≠ê41)](https://github.com/videah/splashy) - Splash Screen Library.
*   [ShakeDetectorLua (‚≠ê7)](https://github.com/azoyan/ShakeDetectorLua) - Uses accelerometer data for shake device detection written in Lua.
*   [tick (‚≠ê91)](https://github.com/bjornbytes/tick) - Useful timing tweaks for L√ñVE's run loop.

### Tutorials

*   [learn2love](https://rvagamejams.com/learn2love/) - Book for learning programming with Lua and L√ñVE (Version 11.0+).
*   [Using Tiled Maps in L√ñVE](http://lua.space/gamedev/using-tiled-maps-in-love) - An article about using maps created with Tiled in your L√ñVE game.
*   [Tutorial on making an Arkanoid-type game (‚≠ê215)](https://github.com/noooway/love2d_arkanoid_tutorial/wiki) - A complete tutorial on how to make a breakout clone by nooowaay.
*   [Simple Game Tutorials](https://simplegametutorials.github.io/) - Tutorials for making simple games with L√ñVE (Snake, Sokoban, Tetris, etc.).
*   [How to L√ñVE](https://sheepolution.com/learn/book/contents) - A book by Sheepolution teaching L√ñVE from the ground up.
*   [CS50 Introduction to Game Development](https://cs50.harvard.edu/games/) - Harvard Colleges CS50 OpenCourseWare.
*   [Building love2d games for the web with love.js and Docker](https://kalis.me/building-love2d-games-web-docker/) - A tutorial on packaging L√ñVE games for the web.

### IDEs

*   [Brackets](http://brackets.io/) - A modern, open source text editor by Adobe (obsolete).
    *   [Lua Syntax Highlighter (‚≠ê4)](https://github.com/ForbesLindesay/brackets-language-extensions) - Add Lua syntax highlighting in Brackets.
    *   [L√ñVE Hints for Brackets.io](https://gitlab.com/sdonalcreative/brackets-love-hints/) - Provides L√ñVE code hints.
    *   [Run L√ñVE (‚≠ê4)](https://github.com/instilledbee/run-love2d) - Run L√ñVE projects with a hotkey.
*   [IntelliJ IDEA](https://www.jetbrains.com/idea/) - Capable and Ergonomic Java IDE.
    *   [EmmyLua (‚≠ê680)](https://github.com/EmmyLua/VSCode-EmmyLua) - Lua IDE/Debugger Plugin for VSCode.
    *   [L√ñVE IDEA (‚≠ê60)](https://github.com/rm-code/love-IDEA-plugin) - Snippets and code completion for IntelliJ-IDEA.
*   [Vim](https://vim.sourceforge.io/) - Vim is a highly configurable text editor built to make creating and changing any kind of text very efficient.
    *   [Vim LOVE Docs (‚≠ê56)](https://github.com/davisdude/vim-love-docs) - Syntax highlighting for Vim.
*   [Notepad++](https://notepad-plus-plus.org) - Notepad++ is a free source code editor and Notepad replacement that supports several languages.
    *   [L√ñVE API for Notepad++ (‚≠ê12)](https://github.com/dail8859/love-api-npp) - Code completion and documentation for Notepad++.

### Distribution

*   [love-export (‚≠ê54)](https://github.com/dmoa/love-export) - Fast and simple command-line tool that builds binaries for you. Supports Windows, macOS, and Linux.
*   [love-deploy (‚≠ê13)](https://github.com/tducasse/love-deploy) - Build and deploy games on itch.io (supports windows and web exports).

### Related

*   [awesome-lua (‚≠ê4.2k)](https://github.com/LewisJEllis/awesome-lua) - A list like this one, but more general and encompassing all of Lua's uses.
*   [awesome-love-shaders (‚≠ê91)](https://github.com/karai17/awesome-love-shaders) - A collection of shaders designed to work in L√ñVE.
*   [awesome-pico8 (‚≠ê2.8k)](https://github.com/pico-8/awesome-PICO-8) - A curated list of PICO-8 resources, tutorials, tools and more.
items.content_html:
3D

  • anim9 (‚≠ê29) - 3D skeletal animation library (design to be used with IQM and IQE).
  • Brinevector3D (‚≠ê11) - FFI-enabled vector library for 3D (x,y,z).
  • IQE (‚≠ê9) - Inter-Quake Export loader (text).
  • IQM (‚≠ê40) - Inter-Quake Model loader (binary).
  • love-gltf - Gltf asset loader and test renderer; Supports skeletal animations and morph targets.
  • Lovox (‚≠ê53) - Pseudo-3D library for working with voxels.

AI

  • Jumper (‚≠ê636) - Grid-based pathfinding library.
  • Lua-star (‚≠ê75) - Easy and pure Lua A* path finding.

Animation

  • andross (‚≠ê33) - A Lua library for 2D skeletal/bone animations with a L√∂ve backend.
  • anim8 (‚≠ê861) - Animation library.
  • animx (‚≠ê29) - A featureful Animation library for loading animations from XML files!.
  • chiro (‚≠ê28) - Convenience wrapper around Spine.
  • Peachy (‚≠ê109) - A parser/renderer for Aseprite animations in L√ñVE.
  • skeletor (‚≠ê23) - 2D skeletal animation system.
  • Walt (‚≠ê61) - Animation library.
  • Lump (‚≠ê20) - Adobe Flash animation runtime.
  • lovanim (‚≠ê35) - A minimal stateful animation library.
  • SYSL-Text (‚≠ê103) - Text animation and automatic wrapping library based on tags.

Camera

  • Brady (‚≠ê61) - Camera library with parallax scrolling.
  • Editgrid (‚≠ê49) - Gamera and HUMP compatible scaling grid.
  • gamera (‚≠ê285) - Camera system.
  • hump.camera - Camera library with window locking and smooth camera movement interpolation.

Development

  • FPSGraph (‚≠ê19) - Small FPS graphing utility.
  • debugGraph (‚≠ê35) - Small OO FPS graphing utillity based on FPSGraph.
  • Lovebird (‚≠ê309) - Browser-based debug console.
  • lurker (‚≠ê330) - Auto-swaps changed Lua files in a running game.
  • L√ñVE API (‚≠ê332) - The complete API documentation of L√ñVE in a Lua table.
  • L√ñVE Build (‚≠ê64) - GitHub Action for automated cross-platform builds.
  • L√ñVE TypeScript Definitions (‚≠ê123) - Write L√ñVE games with TypeScript.
  • lovelier (‚≠ê27) - A L√ñVE live reloader with Moonscript support.

Drawing

  • Artal (‚≠ê43) - A .PSD parsing library for L√ñVE.
  • Autobatch (‚≠ê115) - Small L√ñVE module to automate the use of SpriteBatches.
  • center (‚≠ê17) - A simple module to dynamically align and fit content to screens of any size.
  • deep (‚≠ê90) - Adds Z axis; allows you to queue actions and draw calls.
  • draft (‚≠ê53) - A module for drawing complex shapes.
  • HSLUV (‚≠ê47) - Lua implementation of HSLuv (a human-friendly alternative to HSL).
  • Maid64 (‚≠ê56) - Low resolution scaler for L√ñVE.
  • Push (‚≠ê572) - A simple resolution-handling library for L√ñVE.
  • renderplanet (‚≠ê20) - Realistic orthographic planet rendering.
  • svglover (‚≠ê54) - Library to import and display simple SVGs in L√ñVE.
  • SYSL-Pixel (‚≠ê33) - Pixel art focused scaler for graphics, position, screen-captures and shaders.
  • S√∂lar (‚≠ê8) - A fairly simple solar system simulator.
  • Tove2d (‚≠ê181) - Animated vector graphics for L√ñVE.
  • turtle.lua (‚≠ê100) - Turtle graphics library for L√ñVE.
  • Runtime-TextureAtlas (‚≠ê21) - Texture atlas packer and renderer at runtime; no external tools.
  • Export-TextureAtlas (‚≠ê6) - Extends Runtime-TextureAtlas as a commandline tool to export an atlas.

Entity

  • adorbs (‚≠ê33) - Minimal, Functional Entity Component System.
  • Concord (‚≠ê281) - A feature-complete ECS library.
  • knife.system (‚≠ê485) - Minimalist functional ECS.
  • nata (‚≠ê50) - Hybrid OOP/ECS entity management.
  • tiny-ecs (‚≠ê740) - Entity Component System for Lua that's simple, flexible, and useful.

Helpers

  • astray (‚≠ê165) - Astray is a lua based maze, room and dungeon generation library for dungeon crawlers and roguelike video games.
  • batteries (‚≠ê409) - Fills out lua's sparse standard library and provides implementations of common algorithms and data structures useful for games.
  • clove (‚≠ê30) - A helper library which allows you to quickly loads huge amount of assets.
  • iffy (‚≠ê28) - A SpriteSheet and Tileset helper library for L√ñVE.
  • knife (‚≠ê485) - Collection of useful micro-modules for Lua (Class, State Machines, Bind, Chain, Coroutines, Event, Memoize, Entity, Tests, Timer).
  • shard (‚≠ê20) - Collection of useful mini modules.
  • love-state-switcher (‚≠ê11) - State switcher class for Lua L√ñVE Engine.
  • lue (‚≠ê46) - Lue is a L√ñVE library that allows you to display hue color effects in your game.

Input

  • baton (‚≠ê241) - Input library for L√ñVE that bridges the gap between keyboard and gamepad controls.

Math

  • Bresenham (‚≠ê16) - Bresenham's line algorithm written in Lua.

Networking

  • Grease (‚≠ê114) - Networking library intended to make networking easy for lovers (TCP, UDP, Enet). (IPv6)

OO

  • 30log (‚≠ê477) - Minified framework for object-orientation in Lua. It features named (and unnamed) classes, single inheritance and a basic support for mixins.
  • classic (‚≠ê961) - Tiny class module for Lua. Attempts to stay simple and provide decent performance by avoiding unnecessary over-abstraction.

items.title: Awesome Love2d Updates on Oct 01 - Oct 07, 2018
items.summary: 10 awesome projects updated on Oct 01 - Oct 07, 2018
items.content_text:
### 3D

*   [bump-3dpd (‚≠ê77)](https://github.com/oniietzschan/bump-3dpd) - A 3D collision detection library for Lua.

### Helpers

*   [cartographer (‚≠ê76)](https://github.com/tesselode/cartographer) - Small Tiled map loader and drawer.
*   [lovely-windows (‚≠ê20)](https://github.com/flamendless/lovely-windows) - A Window/Screen Manager Module for virtual windows.

### OO

*   [knife.base (‚≠ê485)](https://github.com/airstruck/knife/blob/master/readme/base.md) - Extremely minimal base class providing single inheritance and constructors.

### Physics

*   [loveblobs](https://github.com/exezin/loveblobs) - A softbody library with support for both dynamic and static arbitrary softbodies.

### Shaders

*   [Moonshine (‚≠ê646)](https://github.com/vrld/moonshine) - Repository of common post-processing effects like blur, vignette, color-grading, etc.

### Tweening

*   [knife.timer (‚≠ê485)](https://github.com/airstruck/knife/blob/master/readme/timer.md) - Create timers and tweens with ease.

### UI

*   [Polywell](https://gitlab.com/technomancy/polywell) - A highly-configurable text editor / coding tool written in Lua that runs on the L√ñVE game engine.

### IDEs

*   [ZeroBrane Studio](https://studio.zerobrane.com/) - ZeroBrane Studio is a lightweight Lua IDE with code completion, syntax highlighting, live coding, code analyzer, and debugging support.
    *   [API Syntax Hightlight (‚≠ê12)](https://github.com/flamendless/LOVE-API-Extractor-for-ZeroBraneStudio) - Script to add LOVE API syntax highlighting to ZBS.
*   [Sublime Text](https://www.sublimetext.com) - Sublime Text is a sophisticated text editor for code, markup and prose. You'll love the slick user interface, extraordinary features and amazing performance.
    *   [Package Manager](https://packagecontrol.io/) - The Sublime Text package manager that makes it exceedingly simple to find, install and keep packages up-to-date.
    *   [SublimeLove](https://packagecontrol.io/packages/SublimeLove) - Supports syntax highlighting, auto-completion, and build system.
    *   [SublimeLinter-luacheck](https://packagecontrol.io/packages/SublimeLinter-luacheck) - Provides linting and static analysis of your Lua code.
